div.p: SMITHIA, in botany : A genus of the decandria order, belonging to the diadelphia claſs of plants ; and in the natural method ranking under the 32d order, Papilionaceœ. The calyx is monophyllous and belabiated ; the corolla winged ; the legumen inclosed in the calyx, with three or four joints, and contain as many ſeeds, which are ſmooth, compreſſed, and kidney-ſhaped. There is only one species, viz. the thοnina.
